feature.name: Primal Path: Path of Karaoke (HB)
feature.text:
Barbarians of the Path of Karaoke turn their rage into performances of epic proportions, using their powerful voices not only to intimidate foes but also inspire allies. Their battles are punctuated by the rhythm of war drums and the melody of ancient songs, transforming the clash of combat into a thunderous concert.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 4 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Stage Presence (Path of Karaoke (HB))
feature.text:
Upon choosing this path at 3rd level, your rage manifests through your mighty songs of power. While raging, you can unleash a song below as a bonus action. Select one of the following effects each time you use this feature, affecting targets within 30 feet.
Intimidating Anthem. Enemies must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals 8+ your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or be frightened until the end of your next turn.
Rallying Cry. Allies gain temporary hit points equal to your Barbarian level + your constitution modifier.
You Are The Champion. You inspire one ally, granting them an extra attack with their reaction.
Rhythm of the Night. Allies' movespeed increases by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 4 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Echoes of Legends (Path of Karaoke (HB))
feature.text:
At 6th level, your voice booms with ancestral power, echoing on the battlefield. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee attack while raging, another creature within 30 feet takes thunder damage equal to your constitution modifier. Additionally, you gain resistance to Force and Thunder damage while raging.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 4 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Primal Scream (Path of Karaoke (HB))
feature.text:
By 10th level, your voice can unleash a primal scream in response to pain. As a reaction when you take damage, you can emit a Scream of the Banshee. Enemies within a 15-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d8 thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (a minimum of once), regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 4 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Encore (Path of Karaoke (HB))
feature.text:
At 14th level, your climactic performances can invoke an Encore, pushing you beyond your limits. When you reduce an enemy to 0 hit points, you can immediately use your Stage Presence feature without expending a use of it. Additionally, once per long rest, after an Encore, you gain resistance to all damage except Psychic for 1 minute, as your performance encapsulates you in a protective aura of sound and fury.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 4 (Homebrew)
